citation.article-title: Bacillus amylolyticus sp. nov., nom. rev., Bacillus lautus sp. nov., nom. rev., Bacillus pabuli sp. nov., nom. rev., and Bacillus validus sp. nov., nom. rev.

p.s: Description of Bacillus lautus nom. rev.
Bacillus lautus (lau'tus. L. part. adj. lautus washed, splendid)
Cells are rods that are 0.5 to 1.0 μm wide by 4.0 to 7.0 μm long.
Growth is not inhibited by 5% NaCl or by 0.001% lysozyme.
The optimum growth temperature is 28 to 30°C, the maximum temperature is 35 to 40°C, and the minimum temperature is 5 to 10°C.
Acetate is utilized; citrate, fumarate, malate, and succinate are not utilized.
L-Rhamnose is fermented in addition to other carbohydrates.
The average G+C content of the DNA is 51 mol%.
Habitat: human intestinal tracts and soil.
The type strain is strain NRRL NRS-666.
The description of this strain is identical to that of the species.
